DOC.brief_summary: Compile acute ( 30-day ) clinical outcome data 9-month angiographic intravascular ultrasound ( IVUS ) data PROMUS Element™ Everolimus- Eluting Coronary Stent System treatment patient single de novo atherosclerotic lesion
DOC.brief_title: A Prospective , Multi-center Trial Assess Everolimus-Eluting Coronary Stent System ( PROMUS Element™ )
DOC.criteria: Patient ( legal guardian ) understand study requirement treatment procedure provide write informed consent studyspecific test procedure perform Patient eligible percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) Patient document stable angina pectoris ( Canadian Cardiovascular Society [ CCS ] Classification 1 , 2 , 3 , 4 ) document silent ischemia ; unstable angina pectoris ( Braunwald Class IBC , IIBC , IIIBC ) Patient acceptable candidate coronary artery bypass grafting ( CABG ) Patient leave ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) > =30 % measure within 30 day prior enrollment Patient willing comply specify followup evaluation Angiographic Target lesion must de novo lesion locate native coronary artery visually estimate diameter > =2.25 mm < =4.25 mm Target lesion length must measure ( visual estimate ) < =34 mm Target lesion must major coronary artery branch visually estimate stenosis > =50 % < 100 % Thrombolysis Myocardial Infarction ( TIMI ) flow > 1 . Patient clinical symptom and/or electrocardiogram ( ECG ) change consistent acute myocardial infarction ( MI ) Patient know diagnosis recent MI ( within 30 day prior index procedure ) elevate enzymes time index procedure follow . Patients exclude follow criterion meet time index procedure If creatine kinase , MB band ( CKMB ) > 2× upper limit normal ( ULN ) , patient exclude regardless creatine kinase ( CK ) Total . If CKMB 12× ULN , patient exclude CK Total > 2× ULN . If CK Total/CKMB use Troponin , patient exclude follow criterion meet time index procedure . Troponin > 1× ULN least one follow . Patient ischemic symptom electrocardiogram ( ECG ) change indicative ongoing ischemia ( e.g. , > 1mm ST segment elevation depression consecutive lead new left bundle branch block [ LBBB ] ) ; Development pathological Qwaves ECG Imaging evidence new loss viable myocardium new regional wall motion abnormality .
